org.biohipi.imagebundle

Class BioHipiImageBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.biohipi.imagebundle.BioHipiImageBundle

  • public class BioHipiImageBundle
extends Object
    A BioHipiImageBundle (BioHIB) is the primary representation for a collection of biomedical images on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) used by BioHIPI. BioHIBs are designed to take advantage of the fact that Hadoop MapReduce is optimized to support efficient processing of large flat files. This class provides basic methods for writing and reading of BioHIBs. A single BioHIB is actually comprised of two files stored on the file system: an index file and a data file. The index file contains a list of byte offsets to the end of each image record (header metadata + image pixel data) in the data file. The data file is composed of a contiguous sequence of image records.
    See Also:
    HIPI Project Homepage

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BioHipiImageBundle.BioHibReader
      This FileReader enables reading individual images from a BioHipiImageBundle and delivers them in the specified image type.

      private void writeBundleHeader()
      BioHIB index file header structure: BOF 4 bytes (int): magic signature (0x81911b18) "HIPIIbIH" 2 bytes (short int): length of data file name var bytes: data file path name 16 bytes: reserved for future use 4 bytes: number of bytes to skip to reach start of offset list [8 byte]*: offsets EOF

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getPath()

      • openForWrite

        public final void openForWrite(boolean overwrite)
                        throws IOException
        Opens the underlying index and data files for writing.
        Parameters:
        overwrite - if either part of the BioHIB file (index and/or data) exists this parameter determines whether or not to delete the file first or throw an exception
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of any I/O errors while creating and opening the index and data files for subsequent writing

      • writeBundleHeader

        private void writeBundleHeader()
                        throws IOException
        BioHIB index file header structure: BOF 4 bytes (int): magic signature (0x81911b18) "HIPIIbIH" 2 bytes (short int): length of data file name var bytes: data file path name 16 bytes: reserved for future use 4 bytes: number of bytes to skip to reach start of offset list [8 byte]*: offsets EOF
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addImage

        public void addImage(BioHipiImageHeader imageHeader,
                     InputStream imageStream)
              throws IOException
        Add image to the BioHIB. This involves appending the image to the data file, and adding the corresponding byte offset to the index file.
        Parameters:
        imageHeader - initialized image header
        imageStream - input stream containing the image data. This data is not decoded or verified to be consistent with the provided image header. It is simply appended to the BioHIB data file.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of any I/O errors or if the BioHIB is not currently in a state that supports adding new images

      • readOffsets

        public List<Long> readOffsets(int maximumNumber)
        Attemps to read some number of image record offsets from the BioHIB index file.
        Parameters:
        maximumNumber - the maximum number of offsets that will be read from the BioHIB index file. The actual number read may be less than this number.
        Returns:
        A list of file offsets read from the BioHIB index file.

      • append

        public void append(BioHipiImageBundle bundle)
        Appends another BioHIB to the current BioHIB. This involves concatenating the underlying data files and index files.
        Parameters:
        bundle - target BioHIB to be appended to the current BioHIB
